law.text: The General Assembly hereby finds and declares that current economic conditions, federal housing policies, and declining resources at the federal, state, and local levels adversely affect the ability of very low-income persons to obtain safe, decent, and affordable housing; that an increasing number of individuals are homeless, are at risk of becoming homeless, or live in overcrowded, inadequate, and unsafe housing units; and it is in the public interest to establish a continuously renewable resource known as an affordable housing trust fund to assist very low-income persons in meeting their basic housing needs.
law.history: Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 458, sec. 2, effective July 14, 1992.
